recipe.name: Clementine Marmalade II
recipe.notes: Clementines are plentiful in Sacramento towards the end of winter.  Having an properly brought up English-Californian wife our household favors a good marmalade.   Given these two facts and this '03 era recipe lurking around, perhaps not a total success?  I do not recall.

ingredient.preparation: cut 1" long and simmered in 4 cups cold water for 30 minutes or until tender
in a vessel for other ingredients
juiced and pulped, pith removed, thence deseeded

recipe.preparation: Combine peel, fruit, and lemon juice and sugar in the boiling water.  Bring to a quick boil {RESEARCH} and cook until mixture is thick and reaches 220F, about 20 minutes.Remove from heat, skim foam and ladle into 1/2 pint jars.  Fill to 1/2" from surface.  Seal in boiling water bath per standard instructions.
